node.title: Bill Browder on Putin, the Magnitsky Act and Russian money laundering
node.description: The American-born financier, who describes how Putin's government operates like an organized crime operation, has been on a mission since his lawyer, Sergei Magnitsky, was tortured and died in prison for having uncovered Russian government officials' tax fraud.

node.title: What are the prospects for pursuing Vladimir Putin for war crimes?
node.description: Investigators have already begun compiling masses of evidence of war crimes committed against Ukrainian civilians by Russian forces – and Putin himself might face indictment.

node.title: CBS News poll on the war in Ukraine: What should the U.S. do now?
node.description: There's strong support for sending more weapons, increased sanctions.

node.title: CBS News Poll: Inflation outweighs jobs on economic views
node.description: Rising prices force cutbacks, and economy continues to take a toll on President Biden's numbers.

node.title: French voters go to the polls in 1st round of presidential election
node.description: Centrist President Emmanuel Macron is seeking a second five-year term, but faces a strong challenge from the far right.

node.title: Trump endorses Oz in Pennsylvania Senate primary race
node.description: Oz had been competing for Trump's endorsement in the May 17 primary against former hedge fund CEO David McCormick.

node.title: Australian federal election to be held 21 May
node.description: Australians will go to the polls to vote for the federal government in six weeks, with Prime Minister Scott Morrison confirming today the election will be held on 21 May. Video

node.title: Home and community support services under threat following proposed pay equity settlement
node.description: The home and community support sector says more funding is essential if its services are to be maintained.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 12 deaths, 6718 community cases, 604 people in hospital
node.description: The number of new community cases reported today has dropped to 6718, with 12 more deaths reported.

node.title: No.8 wire mentality used in Kiwi aid effort in Ukraine
node.description: A New Zealand aid worker in Ukraine says the group he leads was one of the first to provide food in Bucha - where Russian troops executed 150 civilians. Audio

node.title: Plunket to cut parenting programmes due to lack of funding
node.description: Plunket will cut its parenting programmes because it cannot afford to keep running them.

node.title: Three people arrested over 2019 death of man found in Hamilton garden
node.description: Police have arrested three people in relation to the death of Joshua Terrey, who was found dead in a Hamilton garden in 2019.

node.title: Phoenix dominate Western United
node.description: The Wellington Phoenix have defeated Western United 4-1 in their A-League Mens match in Ballarat.

node.title: Anthony Albanese and Scott Morrison in battle to be Australian prime minister
node.description: Both men have spent a good part of their lives in politics but, come May 21, one will be prime minister and the other will likely face the end of his political career.

node.title: Second fire near Awarua Bay contained as flare-ups continue in main blaze
node.description: The initial blaze at Awarua wetlands has been going for a week but today, a car fire under a transmission line power pylon on Tiwai Road spread to dense mānuka scrub.

node.title: Predator control sees native bird life double on West Coast
node.description: Native bird numbers have reached new highs in the Department of Conservation's longest running bird monitoring project.

node.title: New South Wales records 1 million Covid-19 cases in just over two months
node.description: New South Wales took about two years to officially reach 1 million Covid-19 cases, to get to 2 million cases it only took about two and a half months.

node.title: Ukranian civilians in Luhansk region told to flee immediately as Russian forces amass
node.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy says they are ready for a tough battle with Russian forces amassing in the east of the country, and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has offered fresh…

node.title: Oranga Tamariki campaign raises questions on 'process of engagement'
node.description: The Office of the Children's Commissioner is concerned about Oranga Tamariki's new Hear Me, See Me campaign.

node.title: Vintage radio auction goes live, bids start at $10
node.description: Hundreds of vintage radios that were part of a private collection in Auckland are being sold under the hammer.

node.title: Groundwork being done for drone network in Christchurch
node.description: A concept plan is being developed for a city-wide drone network.

node.title: Heritage sticking point sees city councillor dropped from Green ticket
node.description: A Wellington city councillor will this year run as an independent, after being voted out as a candidate for the Green Party.

node.title: Imran Khan ousted as Pakistan's prime minister after key vote
node.description: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan has been ousted from power after losing a no-confidence vote in his leadership.

node.title: 5-alarm fire engulfs Home Depot in San José, California
node.description: Dozens of firefighters were on hand to battle the blaze as crowds gathered in the parking lot to watch.

node.title: "Puppet master" wife orchestrated husband's murder-for hire
node.description: Jamie Faith was ambushed - shot seven times while walking his dog. Why did his wife, Jennifer, want him dead – and had she attempted it before?

node.title: Fire crews quickly contain second blaze to stop it merging with Awarua fire
node.description: Fire crews have worked quickly to stop a second fire merging with the nearby Awarua Bay fire, near Invercargill this morning.

node.title: Two people dead and three others injured in separate crashes
node.description: It's been a deadly Saturday on New Zealand roads, with two killed and three others injured in separate crashes.

node.title: UK defence ministry says Russia targeting civilians in Ukraine
node.description: The British defence ministry said that Russian forces were targeting civilians, a day after a missile attack on a train station killed 52 civilians.

node.title: Central Christchurch occupiers taking green space from residents - councillor
node.description: A Christchurch city councillor is calling for pro-active enforcement from the council and police to end an anti-mandate occupation in the central city.

node.title: Home and community support services under threat following pay equity settlement
node.description: The home and community support sector says more funding is essential if its services are to be maintained.
